name: Mohit Bhole
homeintro: I am studying MS in Computer Science at the University of Texas at Dallas and will graduate in Summer 2022 with a concentration in Intelligent Systems.
homeexperienceintro: Here's my skills and experiences. Check them out!

experience.bullet1: • Develop Angular/NestJS/Kafka/Docker/Kubernetes applications and features to support a wide range of robotics hardware
experience.bullet2: • Implement event logging and device telemetry using a tech-stack powered by Kafka, Mosquitto, and Elasticsearch
experience.bullet3: • Identify needs for alerts and daily automation and set-up watchers in Elasticsearch and a Daily Metrics application for summarizing issues and logging them to Slack, saving the operations team 5 hours per week
experience.bullet4: • Initiate a new project to refactor code and reduce replication, resulting in creation of a Spacee-theme standard UI library that cuts development time in half and is used in all frontend applications
experience.bullet5: • Recognize inefficiency in legacy applications and owned transfer of key features into new applications, entirely eliminating need for legacy support while retaining and improving core functionality of previous software

experience.bullet1: • Develop full-stack software features for various Computer Vision and Robotics products.
experience.bullet2: • Work extensively with Elasticsearch (Kibana) and Kibana Watchers. Create Angular + Python apps for more complex alerts and for Visualizing data.

experience.bullet1: • Develop new features in .NET/SQL/KAFKA application as requested by clients and learned company database schemas and workings between tables to mitigate client issues in production environment.
experience.bullet2: • Monitored server events, KAFKA processing lags, and fixed/reprocessed issues in SQL server database to maintain server health

experience.company: The University of Texas at Dallas
experience.bullet1: • Analyzed and graded programming projects in Data Structures and Algorithms.
• Designed and developed cross-platform mobile applications for Employee Self Service and Ticket Management System.
experience.bullet2: • Used Scrum software process to evolve basic application and include features as required.

projectsintro: Here are some of my solo and team programming projects

projects.title: My Dog Ate my Dating Profile
projects.description: An Angular-based web application and a Python-based webserver that together process a group of adjectives and an essay to produce an NRC emotional analysis, as well as a Big 5 personality analysis of Pet Profiles

projects.title: Sensory Cuff
projects.description: A mobile application built to control a remotely inflatable pressure cuff I made with Arduino to calm autistic students experiencing a sensory overload. The prototype is being tested, and teams are still working to build this.

projects.title: This Portfolio Website!
projects.description: Hosted on firebase and written in Angular, this website is open source for you to use and make a portfolio for yourself! You do not need any programming experience. Good luck!

projects.title: Medila
projects.description: A virtual patient consultation application frontend to help doctors look after patients from home during the coronavirus pandemic.

projects.title: SupplyShare
projects.description: An ecommerce mobile application that allows users to buy items from bulk stores and split them later by getting a driver to deliver the items to them.

projects.title: FitnessApp
projects.description: A quick flutter-built fitness tracker app I built to demonstrate my skills to a potential employer in Pune, India.

projects.title: My ReactJS Portfolio
projects.description: A little more quirky than this portfolio.

projects.title: Machine Learning Control of Transistor Load-Pull Simulation
projects.company: For Qorvo - as part of UTD CS Capstone
projects.description: An automation to simulate radio frequency circuits with different parameters and generate Smith chart using a ML model with 99.8% accuracy.

projects.title: Walk Me Amadeus
projects.company: HackUTA WINNER Best use of HERE-API
projects.description: Developed a Crowd sourced web-based non-roadway based navigation app using heat-based algorithms. Useful for campuses and hiking trails.

projects.title: NEAT Webserver API
projects.description: Developed a Python based server-side code to run an API to train a neural network on multiple computers simultaneously.

aboutnormal: I am a Master's student studying Computer Science at the University of Texas at Dallas actively seeking full time jobs starting August 2022. I am an international student. My primary interests in the field of Computer Science are Machine Learning and Software Development. My passion for this has been very much aroused by hackathons and project experiences throughout college . I know JavaScript, Java, and Python and have a functional understanding of C#, HTML, Bash and GoLang. My technical and conceptual interests lie in web-development, app-development, and machine learning applications in everyday life.
aboutlight: My college GPA is 3.8/4.0 and my undergraduate GPA was 3.8/4.0 at the same university.
aboutprofilepicdesc: This is me in my graudation robe!
aboutcasualnormal: In my free time, I enjoy Rock Climbing, playing Valorant, Volunteering with campus organizations, Hiking and Travelling. Feel free to connect with me and send a message. I'll be very happy to talk!
